GT.content: Derrida “apologizes” for long detour, explains that it marks the step of 2 men in “Counterfeit Money,” rhythm of every incalculable scene of the gift
GT.linkedContent: Derrida “apologizes” for long detour, explains that it marks the step of 2 men in “Counterfeit Money,” rhythm of every incalculable scene of the gift

HASD.content: Derrida explains how he improvised motifs of HASD on the telephone > “how to avoid speaking” at the moment he wanted to defer responsibility of lecture
HASD.linkedContent: Derrida explains how he improvised motifs of HASD on the telephone > “how to avoid speaking” at the moment he wanted to defer responsibility of lecture

HASD.content: in topolitology of secret, figures or places of rhetoric are also political stratagems [Derrida & deconstruction?]
HASD.linkedContent: in topolitology of secret, figures or places of rhetoric are also political stratagems [Derrida & deconstruction?]

HASD.content: Derrida introduces 3 paradigms of apophasis, admitting that this architectural model [paradigms] surrounds a resonant space of which nothing, almost nothing, will ever be said
HASD.linkedContent: Derrida introduces 3 paradigms of apophasis, admitting that this architectural model [paradigms] surrounds a resonant space of which nothing, almost nothing, will ever be said

POOF.content: [refracting the Aristotlean idea that one must love lovence, that it’s more worthwhile (vaut mieux) to love than to be loved, Derrida continually uses phrase “who better (mieux)” re: Nietzsche, as if extending an ambiguous friendship to him]
POOF.linkedContent: [refracting the Aristotlean idea that one must love lovence, that it’s more worthwhile (vaut mieux) to love than to be loved, Derrida continually uses phrase “who better (mieux)” re: Nietzsche, as if extending an ambiguous friendship to him]

A.content: seminar is ending, must rush to end, abruptly [death]
A.linkedContent: seminar is ending, must rush to end, abruptly [death]

VM.content: “without reflecting here on the philosophy of this hesitation”
VM.linkedContent: “without reflecting here on the philosophy of this hesitation”

PAS.content: we will try to approach later [re: what determines eau (thing, name)]
PAS.linkedContent: we will try to approach later [re: what determines eau (thing, name)]

S.content: after discussing Heidegger's most matutinal morning, Derrida says, “I will not keep you here until morning”
S.linkedContent: after discussing Heidegger's most matutinal morning, Derrida says, “I will not keep you here until morning”

S.content: Derrida performs an imaginary question and response btwn Christian theologians and Heidegger
S.linkedContent: Derrida performs an imaginary question and response btwn Christian theologians and Heidegger

OH.content: Derrida will subscribe to European analogic (ideality, capitalization) w/ one hand, write outside it w/ the other
OH.linkedContent: Derrida will subscribe to European analogic (ideality, capitalization) w/ one hand, write outside it w/ the other

OH.content: Derrida precipitates conclusion, which is movement of the head (chef)
OH.linkedContent: Derrida precipitates conclusion, which is movement of the head (chef)

SH.content: after saying multiple singular events can conjoin: Celan quoting Benjamin citing Malebranche on Kafka
SH.linkedContent: after saying multiple singular events can conjoin: Celan quoting Benjamin citing Malebranche on Kafka

SH.content: measureless violence of breaking up rhythm of poem (Derrida says he has to)
SH.linkedContent: measureless violence of breaking up rhythm of poem (Derrida says he has to)

SH.content: [Derrida ends his lecture by dating it, circumcising]
SH.linkedContent: [Derrida ends his lecture by dating it, circumcising]

WM.content: “the exergue effaced” [once section exergue is finished]
WM.linkedContent: “the exergue effaced” [once section exergue is finished]

P.content: “I’m using a reflective route” [moving from example to concept]
P.linkedContent: “I’m using a reflective route” [moving from example to concept]

P.content: [about to discuss the column & the colossal]: “I will take my stand (me tiendrai) in this passage”
P.linkedContent: [about to discuss the column & the colossal]: “I will take my stand (me tiendrai) in this passage”

SP.content: Derrida exposes cryptic structure of writing by “confessing” to it “directly,” re: Nietzsche’s forgetting the umbrella; one could never heed the cryptic warning, what if the “limits of will to mean” are exactly what Nietzsche meant w/ this phrase, an intentional graft
SP.linkedContent: Derrida exposes cryptic structure of writing by “confessing” to it “directly,” re: Nietzsche’s forgetting the umbrella; one could never heed the cryptic warning, what if the “limits of will to mean” are exactly what Nietzsche meant w/ this phrase, an intentional graft

OTO.content: discussing Nietzsche’s vision of the destruction of the University, speaking to the University, Derrida speaks of his own refusal to adhere to a certain pedagogy, while mocking a-ca-dem-ic free-dom [prolongation references taking all the time to finish, not rushing to end]
OTO.linkedContent: discussing Nietzsche’s vision of the destruction of the University, speaking to the University, Derrida speaks of his own refusal to adhere to a certain pedagogy, while mocking a-ca-dem-ic free-dom [prolongation references taking all the time to finish, not rushing to end]

ATIA.content: Derrida will put off until later a reading of Heidegger putting off until later a reading on the animal & time > later, i.e. never
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida will put off until later a reading of Heidegger putting off until later a reading on the animal & time > later, i.e. never

ATIA.content: Derrida will sniff out, hunt down, like an animal, the reasons for confident usage of word “animal”
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida will sniff out, hunt down, like an animal, the reasons for confident usage of word “animal”

ATIA.content: adding syllogistic “therefore” to The Animal That I Am (Follow): “such procedural steps (démarche) should be followed” [machine of inheritance] > to follow: seek to find, seek to escape?
ATIA.linkedContent: adding syllogistic “therefore” to The Animal That I Am (Follow): “such procedural steps (démarche) should be followed” [machine of inheritance] > to follow: seek to find, seek to escape?

DST.content: [while still writing w/in parentheses for 8 pages, Derrida describes the obsessionality of double bind that makes it so one can’t close a parentheses]
DST.linkedContent: [while still writing w/in parentheses for 8 pages, Derrida describes the obsessionality of double bind that makes it so one can’t close a parentheses]

PIO.content: “que vais-je pouvoir inventer encore?” [beginning of essay on invention]
PIO.linkedContent: “que vais-je pouvoir inventer encore?” [beginning of essay on invention]

PIO.content: Ponge’s “Fable”: poetic performative, describes/carries out, on same line, its own generation; telling & told are undecidable, its constative is its performative (not content w/ announcing, it’s located ironically in evangelical tradition, reveals/perverts structure of envoi)
PIO.linkedContent: Ponge’s “Fable”: poetic performative, describes/carries out, on same line, its own generation; telling & told are undecidable, its constative is its performative (not content w/ announcing, it’s located ironically in evangelical tradition, reveals/perverts structure of envoi)

PIO.content: constative (discovering, unveiling, pointing out [manifester], dire ce qui est); performative (producing, instituting, transforming) > “Fable” is co-implication of these 2 values; “Fable” is exemplary > invents by means of enunciation (performs/describes, operates/states)
PIO.linkedContent: constative (discovering, unveiling, pointing out [manifester], dire ce qui est); performative (producing, instituting, transforming) > “Fable” is co-implication of these 2 values; “Fable” is exemplary > invents by means of enunciation (performs/describes, operates/states)

HLP.content: I will not tell you the whole truth about a history of the lie, not even what I think it’s necessary to say, I will not say the whole truth of what I think: a lacunary testimony
HLP.linkedContent: I will not tell you the whole truth about a history of the lie, not even what I think it’s necessary to say, I will not say the whole truth of what I think: a lacunary testimony

WAP.content: [speaking of teaching body] hear I am, the teaching body, in what way is this a glorious body? all light on me > it is also glorious because no longer a body: sublimated, at once part/whole of general teaching body, representative of philosophical/sociopolitical corpus [also, he is contraband]
WAP.linkedContent: [speaking of teaching body] hear I am, the teaching body, in what way is this a glorious body? all light on me > it is also glorious because no longer a body: sublimated, at once part/whole of general teaching body, representative of philosophical/sociopolitical corpus [also, he is contraband]

WAP.content: “The Crisis in Teaching” — a rather slow way of “preparing to listen to you”
WAP.linkedContent: “The Crisis in Teaching” — a rather slow way of “preparing to listen to you”

REST.content: “give me credit for the moment,” “allow me a slight advance…”
REST.linkedContent: “give me credit for the moment,” “allow me a slight advance…”

TR.content: Derrida confesses theft so to excuse himself for it [re: de Man’s unjust justice]
TR.linkedContent: Derrida confesses theft so to excuse himself for it [re: de Man’s unjust justice]

C.content: [to re-capture the contingency of Titus-Carmel’s 127, Derrida divides the text by “what seems” an arbitrary amount of dated entries]
C.linkedContent: [to re-capture the contingency of Titus-Carmel’s 127, Derrida divides the text by “what seems” an arbitrary amount of dated entries]

C.content: get down to it (s’y mettre), commit oneself, donner du gage (give proof, evidence, wager) > get in the coffin [writing about coffins], spread out
C.linkedContent: get down to it (s’y mettre), commit oneself, donner du gage (give proof, evidence, wager) > get in the coffin [writing about coffins], spread out

C.content: [Derrida focuses throughout on contingency of Titus-Carmel’s decision to make 127 coffins; here, he indulges in wild speculations: anagrams, palindromes, numerical values]
C.linkedContent: [Derrida focuses throughout on contingency of Titus-Carmel’s decision to make 127 coffins; here, he indulges in wild speculations: anagrams, palindromes, numerical values]

LI.content: Derrida will cite Sarl at length to enrich iterative corpus which is the object of discussion [pushing the issue of parasitic contamination]
LI.linkedContent: Derrida will cite Sarl at length to enrich iterative corpus which is the object of discussion [pushing the issue of parasitic contamination]

BSi.content: “reason of strongest always best” is violently tautological [Derrida’s “gonna show” this tautology, but never does, thus (as the professor, as the strongest in the room) he does show it (a performative demonstration)]
BSi.linkedContent: “reason of strongest always best” is violently tautological [Derrida’s “gonna show” this tautology, but never does, thus (as the professor, as the strongest in the room) he does show it (a performative demonstration)]

BSi.content: Derrida intentionally neglected to introduce a wolf in Machiavelli [?]
BSi.linkedContent: Derrida intentionally neglected to introduce a wolf in Machiavelli [?]

SPEC.content: same step (pas) [Freud’s step beyond PP] gives & suspends movement, es gibt, exemplary movement of paralysis [Derrida repeating too, cf. FSW, PAS] [démarche]
SPEC.linkedContent: same step (pas) [Freud’s step beyond PP] gives & suspends movement, es gibt, exemplary movement of paralysis [Derrida repeating too, cf. FSW, PAS] [démarche]

SPEC.content: je le suppose relu [re: Freud’s Beyond…]—gagner le temps (or essential form of that which interests the speculation)
SPEC.linkedContent: je le suppose relu [re: Freud’s Beyond…]—gagner le temps (or essential form of that which interests the speculation)

SPEC.content: death is the analogon of castration > castration not incompatible w/ thesis of death drive if one refers to syntaxic articulation of athesis: Derrida’s pointing to “it” at this moment
SPEC.linkedContent: death is the analogon of castration > castration not incompatible w/ thesis of death drive if one refers to syntaxic articulation of athesis: Derrida’s pointing to “it” at this moment

SPEC.content: Derrida’s limiting the pleasure he can give himself tonight [re: comparison of fort/da to Symposium]
SPEC.linkedContent: Derrida’s limiting the pleasure he can give himself tonight [re: comparison of fort/da to Symposium]

SPEC.content: s’il faut se rendre à ce qu’il faut echaîner strictement [if it’s necessary to submit to what must follow strictly] re: le mot de maîtrise, going beyond oppositional logic—is there mastery?
SPEC.linkedContent: s’il faut se rendre à ce qu’il faut echaîner strictement [if it’s necessary to submit to what must follow strictly] re: le mot de maîtrise, going beyond oppositional logic—is there mastery?

FV.content: throughout an essay that deconstructs arrival of letter, Derrida continually says: “we’re not there yet”
FV.linkedContent: throughout an essay that deconstructs arrival of letter, Derrida continually says: “we’re not there yet”
